meanings.definition: The act of pretending to be something one is not.
meanings.sent1: Her many fakeries made it hard to know the real her.
meanings.sent2: The detective uncovered the fakeries of the impostor.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's hilarious fakeries always made the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: The fakeries of the magician left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent5: The fakeries of the actor were so convincing, they fooled everyone.

meanings.definition: Things that are fake or counterfeit.
meanings.sent1: The market was flooded with cheap fakeries of designer handbags.
meanings.sent2: The museum had a collection of historical fakeries on display.
meanings.sent3: The fakeries sold on the street corner were of poor quality.
meanings.sent4: The fakeries of the painting were revealed under close inspection.
meanings.sent5: The fakeries of the jewelry were so well-made, even experts were fooled.
